Get ready for the switch from Sideview Utils to Canary

In Splunk 8.0, the "Advanced XML" systems of SplunkWeb are being removed or disabled, and our new app "Canary" will become the new dependency that you need to run your Sideview XML views and dashboards. If your views are edited according to the best-practices of Sideview Utils, perhaps somewhat surprisingly, you'll be able to run them in the Canary UI even in Splunk 8.0 !

Canary is available on Splunkbase but first read more about the Canary app here..

Don't get rid of Sideview Utils just yet - during a transitional period you'll actually want to have Sideview Utils here to properly redirect users to the appropriate URL in the Canary UI, if their browser should happen to land on legacy Advanced XML URL's.

Above all, contact us with any questions either in the #canary channel on the Splunk slack, or by emailing us at support@sideviewapps.com

module.name: HTML
module.param:
If 8.0 is not on your radar yet, switch to Canary anyway!

But ok if you don't want to, if you're going to stay on Splunk 7.X for the foreseeable future, here's what you need to know to get started with Sideview Utils:

  1. that Splunk "views" are composed of "modules", and how modules communicate information "downstream". If you don't know this then read this page carefully a few times.
  2. That to use Sideview modules in a view you MUST also include a "SideviewUtils" module in the view. It is invisible but necessary. Put it at the top of the view so it's out of the way.
  3. You're ready. Study the examples in this app and use as much or as little as you want/need. Get on our mailing list to stay on top of new releases.
Get Started!
